item.title: Convince your manager
item.description:
Convince your manager in order to attend AngularCamp

You want to attend AngularCamp happening in Barcelona from July 1-3, 2016, but don’t know how to bring it up to your manager (the person with the money)? We laid out a five major reasons and a sample letter explaining why it is important. Use it in full or use snippets of it, whatever it takes to get you to AngularCamp Barcelona!


> Five Reasons to Attend AngularCamp:
  1. Learn what works (and what doesn’t) in the real world. Let someone else’s hard-earned experience be your guide. With case studies and tales from the trenches, you’ll learn best practices, save time, and dodge the pitfalls that have vexed others.
  2. Be part of the conversation shaping the Web. AngularCamp is where important conversations take place and where big ideas explode into being. You’ll come away inspired and eager to test what you’ve learned.
  3. Make valuable connections. AngularCamp is designed to make networking easy, even if networking doesn’t come naturally to you. A large conference with a small-conference feel, AngularCamp provides ample opportunities to meet and compare experiences with others.
  4. Aim for the future. Be among the first to hear about emerging technologies and explore what’s on the horizon with the visionaries of the web platform.
  5. There will be a lot of sessions in the three days of AngularCamp. These sessions include visionary keynotes, hands-on tutorials, deep-dive technical lectures, and presentations.


> Letter

Dear [ManagersName],

I’d like to attend AngularCamp Conference taking place July 1-3, 2016, in Barcelona. There are a lot of Angular conferences during the year, but this is the premier conference put on for and by the the community around it. Vendor-neutral by design, it is focused on everything from fine-tuning my skills in AngularJS to the future of the framework.

They are anticipating more than 300 individuals will attend the event. The conference welcomes experienced developers as well as those interested in learning how to implement AngularJS into their business, and everyone in between. Here are just a few advantages of me going to the conference:

  1. One of the great features about the technology is how diverse it is. It can be used to build mobile apps or enterprise apps, and almost every single big named company is using it from PayPal to Google to Disney. If we decide to build out our product strategy or offering, it is likely that AngularJS will be the technology that I use across the board.

  2. There will be more than 30 sessions in the three day conference. These sessions include visionary keynotes, hands-on tutorials, deep-dive technical lectures, and presentations.

  3. The session will not only craft my skills with AngularJS, but also help me learn how best to adopt the technology to our business for smoother transitions and a more united Developer team.

  4. Key session include: Angular 2.0 with realtime GraphQL, Progressive Web Apps with Angular 2, From the World-Wide Web to the World of IoT, TypeScript fundamentals,… The full list of program can be found here: http://angularcamp.org/schedule/

The registration price is € 230. It includes registration and full access to all of the events happening at the AngularCamp.

I would be happy to write a post-conference report and share with other members of the team on what I’ve learned and how we can implement Angular as well as open source governing practices into our business strategy.

Thanks, [ YourName ]

item.title: Diversity Tickets
item.description:
Diversity Tickets: Now accepting applications

We have now opened our application for our Diversity Attendee Tickets. If you would like to apply, fill out our easy question application. These are free tickets to AngularCamp supported by generous community members.

Since we are a non-profit conference, it is tough to give out free tickets, but we start one of our new initiatives is to reserve a contingent of tickets for groups and organisations that work on diversity in tech and offer them to buy a ticket outside of the regular and hectic ticket release schedule.

We believe that a more diverse crowd makes for a better event and community. If you agree, we invite you to become a Diversity Suporter by buying one of the five Diversity Supporter tickets.

item.title: Speakers & Schedule
item.description:
News

Because learning never exhausts the mind.
Join us to Learn, Share & Discover at AngularCamp

We are thrilled to announce first Angular Conference happening in Barcelona @ Disseny Hub Barcelona and also we repeat experience with AngularCamp: a multi track un-conference style with more than 25 contributors a day by people inside the community like you and a lot of activities to engage people to start: learning, sharing, discovering all together in a safe environment for everybody. You decide what will happen: send us your interest or your contribution (a talk? a workshop? do you have a crazy idea? we want to hear you ^__^

We want to keep motivation, illusion and passion inside Angular community providing to our members a more affordable ticket prices just for covering event expenses: this includes creating an atmosphere where everyone feels welcome as well as different activities with best selected venues that fits with your needs to make it happen!

AngularCamp Conference is a non-profit and single track conference carefully crafted with love for you with twelve talks a day by internationally renowned community speakers, hope to see you there!


>Community Speakers
  • Uri Shaked. BlackBerry, Israel
  • Todd Motto. Telerik, U.K.
  • Thorsten Hans. Thinktecture, Germany
  • Evan Schultz. rangle.io, Canada
  • Wassim Chegman. SFEIR, France
  • Maxim Salnikov. ForgeRock, Norway
  • Manfred Steyer. SoftwareArchitekt.at, Austria
  • Uri Goldshtein. Meteor, Israel
  • Sebastian Witalek. Telerik, UK
  • Vanesa Yuen. rangle.io, Canada
  • Igor Kamenetsky. rangle.io, Canada
  • Christoffer Noring. Ovo Energy, Sweden
> Organizers

AngularCamp is organized by David Pich from AngularBeers, the University of Barcelona and co-organized with our friend Johannes Weber from AngularJS Munich.

> Check out the schedule

(Still subject to change, so please check often)

http://angularcamp.org/schedule/

> RSVP your ticket now: [limited tickets]

http://angularcamp.org/tickets/

> Ticket includes :

Food, drinks, fun and some surprises we will announce soon.



More details about workshops will appear in subsequent posts, meantime like us on Facebook, follow on Twitter, add to circles in Google+ or subcribe to our mailing list and RSS feed in order not to miss any cool stuff about AngularCamp.

item.title: Call for Papers
item.description:
AngularCamp Barcelona 2016

You may be wondering what’s going on in an AngularCamp. The first AngularCamp happened in 30-31th January 2016 and we hope the next ones will come easily to more locations.

AngularCamp Barcelona 2016 will be held 1st-2nd-3rd of July. If you want to be part of this growing community event as a speaker contact hello@angularcamp.org

Everyone from newbies to experts are welcome to participate in order to share, learn and get to know each other.

Angular Camp Barcelona is proudly organized by Angular & Beers in collaboration with the University of Barcelona @ Park Humanities and Social Sciences

AngularCamp Conference (1st July): themes and topics

Our team prepared set of interesting topics in but if you have any cool idea you want to share, feel free to submit it as well.

Angular Camp (2nd-3rd July):

Everyone is invited to give a talk: at the days of the conference we all vote together which talks we would love to see - the talks with the most votes will be put on the schedule then. We are looking forward to many awesome sessions with you at AngularCamp! You can propose them by adding a new issue on https://github.com/AngularCamp/angularcamp.org/issues

Please submit your proposals here.

Deadline is May 1, 2016

Please note: There is no guarantee that a submission will be put onto the conference agenda!

The program committee picks the most interesting talk proposals and informs the selected submitters until May 15, 2016.

Any questions?

Email organizers at hello@angularcamp.org

item.title: Hello World!
item.description:
Welcome to your community

First AngularCamp has been an unbelievable community experience and we are excited to announce the first Angular Camp & Conference in Barcelona @ Disseny Hub Barcelona.

Tickets will be limited so get notified when tickets are available by signing up to our newsletter and don’t miss out the opportunity of joining a growing community.

Event quick facts

So should you also be excited? Well yes… and here’s why!

  • Attendance: we’re expecting over 320 attendees
  • Topic: more than 30 hours of Angular topics related
  • Date: 1-2-3 July, expect workshops on 30th June, Angular Conference on the 1st July and camp 2nd-3rd July.
  • Venue: Disseny Hub Barcelona - with an amazing cinema screen 16:9
  • Speakers: we’re in the process of getting proposals

but we’ve already secured a first batch of experts:

  • Todd Motto - Todd is a Developer Advocate at Telerik. Google Developer Expert
  • Wassim Chegham - Core contributor to Angular Universal and more. JavaScript enthusiast • Angular GDE.
  • Uri Shaked - Google Developer Expert for AngularJS. He created the popular angular-moment open source module and regularly speaks about Web-related technologies in conferences and meetups. Among his interests are reverse engineering, hardware hacking, playing music and Salsa dancing.



More details about speakers, workshops will appear in subsequent posts, meantime like us on Facebook, follow on Twitter, add to circles in Google+ or subcribe to our mailing list and RSS feed in order not to miss any cool stuff about AngularCamp.

Focused on the attendees

An AngularCamp can’t get compared with annual worldwide AngularJS conferences: AngularCamp wants to keep motivation and passion inside community with more constant meetups driven from inside the community.

AngularCamps don’t need to be big, fancy or expensive events. AngularCamps are meant to be focused on the attendees and their expectations in a cost effective way, based on the local investment available to support it. Typically venues should be cheap to allow attendees to join the event and make it more accessible to all in order to attend, meet people, share experiences and knowledge, and learn together.

Supporters and donations make all this possible, keeping ticket prices very low below for a 2-day event. It’s not strange that also collaborators will join for free because all it’s focused to create a sustainable community as well a safe environment where everyone can join the community.

Engage collaboration.

We want to use the internet to get off the internet. Getting to meet and learn from other people face-to-face is one of the main reasons people attend AngularCamps.

Thanks to AngularCamps’ volunteers, they will try to help fellow attendees with their questions in addition to learning from each other. Attendees have a great opportunity to find new friends, collaborators and potential inspiration in the AngularCamp crowd. All these can lead to an exciting, sustainable and engaged community driven.

Every AngularCamp is a “big event” of a local AngularJS meetup group (indeed if it doesn’t exist is a great way to kick it off)

Think globally, act locally

The AngularCamp calendar is coordinated by AngularCamp.org but each individual meetup is organized by local AngularJS people. We will provide guidance but we not taking any decisions. AngularCamp are not meant to be an event with the same collaborators at every event, so we will try to tend to have both local and visiting collaborators.

Supporters

Want to get involved and help support AngularCamp Barcelona?We’d love to hear from you.

Non-profit

AngularCamps will use supporters money and donations to benefit the community not treated as profit to be pocketed by the organizers.

AngularCamps organized as money-making opportunities are not approved to use the AngularCamp name.

Safe environment & Fun

AngularCamps are meant to be focused on: safe environment (CoC), learning, sharing and socialize with people but most important: have fun without lose the focus. There will be different activities, spaces and actions to make it happen (need to go beyond the code)
